intro: Mulgedium rapunculoides, commonly known as the false rapunculus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, round fruits known as silicles, which contain several seeds. It is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas. Mulgedium rapunculoides is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
